name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
[Click with caution] Netizens’ submissions
On July 1, it was reported online that a school bullying incident occurred in Jinzhong City, Shanxi Province, and three minors forced a boy to eat feces.
According to the local police notice, the incident has been settled, but a blogger said that after the incident fermented, the police summoned the child’s father at 10 o’clock in the middle of the night, and no one was allowed to accompany him. He was not allowed to go home until he pressed the reconciliation fingerprint at 2 o’clock in the morning
Currently, the Jiexiu police account has been set to private.

Netizen contribution
On July 2, an air conditioner outdoor unit suddenly fell down on Minde Road in Nanchang, Jiangxi, hitting a passerby.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
Netizen contribution
"When Baimang Village becomes a busy village"
Recently, Shenzhen announced that it would carry out unified renting and renovation of urban villages, that is, the government would uniformly collect and store urban village housing for renovation, and upgrade surrounding supporting facilities, and then rent them out, and local state-owned enterprises would become the largest second landlord.
This move was questioned by the outside world as Shenzhen's beginning to clean up the "low-end population", because unified renting not only means that rents are about to rise sharply, but also that the original tenants must be cleared out before the house is renovated; others found that the age requirement for the contract after unified renting is limited to 18-40 years old, which means that migrant workers over 40 years old will no longer be able to rent houses in Shenzhen.
In response, Red Star Video made a series of reports, reflecting the various aspects of Baimang Village under the unified renting trend. Many middle-aged people who have devoted half their lives to Shenzhen will have to face the problem of leaving this land where they are about to take root.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: There are rumors online that Huaxi Nuclear, which previously engaged in nucleic acid business, has begun to enter the housing rental market, and "Zhang Hezi's unified rental housing" has become a hot search. At the same time, many netizens have also expressed their opinions. According to statistics, Shenzhen currently has 104 urban villages included in the unified rental list.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: @realcaixia I'm used to it. To this day, some people still haven't gotten rid of the Cultural Revolution mentality. There's no way to discuss issues. There's only black and white. If you agree with a sentence, you're one of us. If you don't agree with a sentence, you're a spy propaganda. It's standard and dynamic and casual. Whenever the tweeters want to say something, they have to fight over the color first. As long as the color is right, right or wrong doesn't matter. If the color is wrong, no matter how much you say, it's useless.

[I don’t have a mother anymore]
On July 1, a media outlet reported that an elderly man in Huaibei, Anhui, who was ill and feared that he would burden his children, drank pesticides and secretly left home while holding his stomach.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: At the same time, the Eight O'Clock News was banned for publishing an article titled "The Unstoppable Rise in Drug Prices".

June 28, Putian City, Fujian. A netizen posted a picture saying that he received a group text message from Xiuyu District, requiring him to answer the "sense of security assessment" phone number: social security is good, the crackdown on gangs and evil is effective, conflicts and disputes are resolved, and law enforcement work is satisfactory.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
Netizen contribution
On July 3, the media reported that the prices of Chinese medicinal materials have also begun to soar in recent days, with prices generally rising by more than 50%, and the price of 25 commonly used medicinal materials has even increased by more than 200%.
According to relevant chambers of commerce, a large amount of social capital has poured in to hoard medicinal materials.
